Reviews.Title: “The hotel the holiday maketh”
Reviews.Author: WeilingGaby
Reviews.Content: This small hotel of 8 rooms made use of its boutique status to give guests a truly warm and personalised experience that has for us been unmatched. My husband and I travel a lot and we have never met a more sincere hospitality staff. The staff were not at all the tips-seeking variety that we usually meet. Every exchange with them felt sincere. The hotel goes all out to give rooms a personal touch. The decor was tastefully done and impressed us immediately. The moment I entered the room, I could almost feel the person who had done up the room. There were delicate details like the arrangement of towels on the beds. Breakfasts also had a homemade quality to them. I believe there exists a good relationship between the staff and the hotel owners (whom we did see quite often during our 4 night stay). We went there in spring when most hotels have switched off the central air-conditioning. However, it was warm on the first night. It is not so comfortable leaving the windows open as there are sudden loud noises from passing traffic (not much traffic on the small lane, but enough to be disruptive) in the middle of the night. The next day, we asked if the air-conditioning could be turned on, and the staff promised confidently that he'd make a request to management. For that one night, we had air-con! (The system was switched back to heating when the temperature took a drastic fall the next two days.) I truly appreciate this gesture to be flexible and accommodating -- something you will not find in the big hotels. As we were travelling with my 1.5 year old toddler, we spent a lot of time in the hotel (afternoons for her naptime, and early evenings back). My daughter absolutely loved her experience and didn't want to go home. The common area was small, but homely, and completely satisfactory to my toddler. The staff played with my daughter everyday and entertained her with the little hotel bird. During our stay, we had to make a trip to a very local area as we were buying a double buggy that wasn't displayed in most shops. Cengiz Demirli, the owner (with his father), was at the reception in the afternoons and he made phonecalls to make arrangements for us to view the buggy. He even got us a discount over the phone. When we were at the shop itself and had trouble with credit card payment and the shopowners could not understand English, Cengiz was so helpful when we called him to mediate the situation. He was also present to assist us during the delivery and setup of the buggy to the hotel the next afternoon. We have many other lovely experiences during our rather intensive 4-afternoon-and-night stay that only you can appreciate if you were there. (= Highly highly highly recommended. The hospitality and accommodation was THE holiday itself for us. It left us feeling so good about the people of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and warm reception”
Reviews.Author: Michel-Lyne
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week at the Esans hotel. The location is ideal: close to the main sites and at the same time on a very quiet street. It is a small hotel, looking very simple from outside; very clean, nice terasse on the roof, good breakfast with a fresh squeezed orange juice every morning. Engin and the staff have been exceptional, always full of attention and ready to help.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location, A Staff That's Other-worldly”
Reviews.Author: D F
Reviews.Content: My family and I loved our stay at Esans Hotel; it definitely made our visit to Istanbul memorable. The location of the hotel is fantastic - just a three minute walk to Topkapi Palace and a five minute walk to the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sofia, as well as the nearest tram stop. Even if the hotel was lacking it's fantastic location, I would still be giving it 5 stars for 1. it's super, super, super helpful staff (especially Engin!!!) 2. its tasteful decor 3. how clean it is!! 4. its delicious morning breakfast, which is buffet-style and which features a bunch of mezze and other dishes and which is really more than a buffet; you're served a glass of fresh-squeezed OJ at breakfast and are also offered an omelet if the egg dish has run low! Really what makes this hotel so special is its staff who go out of their way to help give you directions, book tours and tickets for you, recommend Turkish baths or Bosphorus cruises, etc. This is the best small hotel I've ever stayed at and would not recommend that anyone stay anywhere else during their visit to Istanbul!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Charul G
Reviews.Content: Great location. Situated in the Sultanahmet district which is the heart of historic Old Istanbul. All the major tourist desinations are just a short walk away. We covered all the places mostly walking as the location of hotel was really convenient. It is at a walking distance to one of the quite and peaceful shores of bosphorus sea. Just the next lane to the back side of the hotel is a street full of eating joints. Nice rooms, furnished and decorated in traditional Ottomanian style. Hotel staff is very helpful and courteous. They are ready to help you with every small thing. Because of our hectic travel plans, we slept a bit longer and got late for the breakfast next day. They still waited for us and did not stop the breakfast buffet that they have with the room package. The only small issue is the noise that comes from the street. The rooms here are not sound proof, so you get a lot of noise from the streets. This also is not a major one, as if you are touring throughout the day and get tired, you are just fast asleep at night. Overall a very nice stay :)

Reviews.Title: “Super small family hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: MarkLeni
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in February 2012 and really could not fault the place. Lovely well decorated rooms and staff eager and willing to help. It is within a few minutes walk of The blue Mosque, Topkapi palace, Aya Sofia and the tram network. Plenty of restaurants close by but I would recommend the Mosaik a little further away for excellent local cuisine. Free internet available. They organised a two day excursion to Gallipoli and Troy which was an amazing experience. Thanks to all at the hotel for an amazing holiday

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel, great location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: JennKopf
Reviews.Content: Esans Hotel is without a doubt the best hotel that I've ever stayed at, especially for the price. The staff here are truly exceptional and go above and beyond to make sure that your stay is a pleasant one. One particularly nice amenity that they offer is free international calls home from the lobby. Whenever we found ourselves in the lobby we were offered tea or coffee and we had great conversations with the staff. On our last night, they even upgraded us to a superior room free of charge just because it was available! The hotel itself is in an awesome location with relatively big, beautifully-decorated rooms. The street that the hotel is on is quiet and we slept great while we were there. We also really enjoyed the breakfast selection, especially the freshly-squeezed orange juice, cookies, and Turkish tea. I really can't speak highly enough of our stay at this hotel. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Hellen_and_Andy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in Istanbul in November 2011 after reading reviews from other travellers. We would like to say a lot of thanks to the staff there, in particular Engin Coskun who was a great host, he made our stay both enjoyable and comfortable. He provided us tips for many local attractions and restaurants. It is indeed a lovely hotel with a team who truly enjoy their work and helping guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Amenities, Small Room”
Reviews.Author: Christina123_12
Reviews.Content: The Esans Hotel is located in a great area with rows of shops and restaurants. It's minutes away from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. Upon arrival, visitors are allow one international call. Free wifi is available or one can use the communal laptop in the lobby. The breakfast is excellent with fresh crepes, orange juice (one per customer), and eggs. The staff is extremely helpful and knowledgable. Overall, if you like B&B-esque places, this is the place for you. Please note, rooms are rather small; however, if you are one who travels light, it's not so noticeable. Also, the hotel bumps up next to a mosque; for the light sleeper, this means audible 5:00am prayer calls.

Reviews.Title: “A little Gem with great Location and Staff that care”
Reviews.Author: rjpgp
Reviews.Content: We were two couples who had never visited Istanbul before. A Small Hotel on three floors. We had a Standard & Superior Room and both were a good size but felt paying more for the extra space of a Superior Room worth the money Location was great, all main attractions an easy walk as people have said before. Some very nice Restaurants all close by and whole area seemed very safe. Staff could not have been more helpful and truly made us feel at home. We booked direct and got a great overall price.

Reviews.Title: “All Good Things Come in Small packages!! :)”
Reviews.Author: justbala
Reviews.Content: I had 30 hour transit in Istanbul at the last moment due to my flight timings and had to book a last minute stay at a hotel in a city that I have never been to. Saw the positive reviews on this forum and decided to try Esans (plus the price for a single room was around 60$). I was however apprehensive since the property seemed quite small. I reached the hotel quite early at 5 AM and unfortunately all rooms were full. The night receptionist (Dauliat fromTurkmenistan) kept me company during the entire duration, offered tea and coffee and ensured tht as soon as the first check out happened, the cleaning staff had my room ready in no time. I got my room a lil after 8 AM with no additional charge for an early checkin. The rooms are done quite tastefull, albeit slightly on the opulent side, The terrace offers some magnificent views of the Bosphorus and Hagia Sophia. Pros : 1) Close to all major sites in Sultanahmet - TopKapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Grand Bazar 2)Amazing Breakfast spread. Good Turkish Spread. In the summer I was told the breakfast is served on the rooftop terrace. 3)Nicely done rooms 4)The best part of the stay - the staff - i dont remember having seen such an enthusiastic and dedicated staff in any hotel around the world.The young staff ensure you feel at home and are always willing to help you with anything you would require. Cons: 1) The hotel does not have a lift/elevator. Hence access to all might be a problem. 2)The walls are quite thin. So you could end up hearing conversations and footfalls from rooms around you. Apart from these minor issues, the stay at Esans was mind blowing. I am sure I would be back for a longer stay here in the Summer.

Reviews.Title: “Good Base For Exploring the Old City”
Reviews.Author: nick w
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the family-owned Esans hotel which is just a 5 minute walk from the historic sights around Sultanahmet Square (Blue Mosque. Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace etc). The hotel is a converted 19th century Ottoman era house (belonging originally to a perfumer) which was opened as hotel about a year ago. Throughout our stay the staff were extremely friendly and attentive without being overly so. The rooms were spacious with comfortable beds although the sound proofing was not great, we were on the first floor and could hear the occupants of the room above. The staff acknowledged that this has been an issue for some and stated they will be carpetting the wooden floors to help improve sound proofing. However, such noise is probably always to be a little expected in conversions of old buildings. The breakfast was homemade and very tasty with a good selection of Turkish and non-Turkish foods to choose from. However, the selection on offer - though very good - was not as extensive as some reviewers have implied. The hotel is able to arrange to collect from the airport though for the return journey you'll need to either use public transpott or take a local taxi (an 'interestingly fast' experience!). Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Esan.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great location.”
Reviews.Author: 2kornsontherun
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Istanbul at the Hotel Esans was great. The location was perfect, in the Sulfanahmet area, just a very short walk from the Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque and other attractions. This is a very small hotel, with only 8 rooms, but service was great, with the hotel staff being extremely friendly and very helpful. We felt that they really went out of their way to make our stay as enjoyable as possible. They made numerous recommendations for us as far as restaurants, attractions and getting around the city. The breakfast was adequate and quite good, with a selection of Turkish breakfast foods served buffet style each morning. The rooms are small, but quite comfortable. The bathrooms were also small, but adequate. We have stayed in many European hotels, so this was not a surprise, nor was it any inconvenience for us. A note to travelers: it is a 3 story hotel with no elevator. So if you have difficulty climbing stairs, you may want to consider staying elsewhere. For us, this was not a problem at all. The hotel has a lovely roof terrace with some spectacular views of the Hagia Sofia. The hotel also has complimentary wireless internet access. All in all, it was a great place to stay in Istanbul. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel in the heart of Instanbul”
Reviews.Author: AthinaP987
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband visited Istanbul on the first week of February and stayed in Esans Hotel for three nights. Esans Hotel is an excellent choice for those who visit Istanbul.The hotel is five minutes walking from all the major attractions and the tram, so in 15 minutes you can be in Taksim Square and Galatas Tower. The staff was really helpful and kind and always there if you have any question about the transportation etc. We really enjoy the breakfast. Although the weather was cold, our room was always warm. It will certainly be our first choice the next time we visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “The essance of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Ceci_12
Reviews.Content: From the moment my friends and i stepped into this charming little hotel we felt instantly welcomed. The staff were all so friendly and helpful, going above and beyond to ensure that we were able to make the most of our five nights in Istanbul. Nothing was too much trouble and we had many great meals and experiences based on their recommendations. The hotel was perfectly located, just a 5-10 minute walk to all the main attractions as well as resturaunts and markets. Rooms were all beautifully adorned and very clean. Cannot recommend Esans hotel enough, can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Clemente B
Reviews.Content: I am sure there are many fine places to stay in Istanbul, and the Esans Hotel is certainly one of them. From the moment we walked in without a booking, it was clear that the staff here really look after their guests and give them exceptional help and service. It was a pity we could only stay here for two nights. We were given a lovely 'superior' room 302 facing south towards the Sea of Mamara and loved every minute of our short stay. The room was beautifully decorated with a quirky style (and wallpaper), and had some lovely personal touches which only an exceptional hotelier would think of. As a newcomer to the Istanbul Hotel scene, the Esans Hotel seems to be making a fantastic effort to impress - the rooms have been carefully and tastefully decorated The location is pretty good, on the quiet side of Sultanahmet and near the mean sights as well as some fine places to eat, drink and sit around. The hotel is on a quiet corner down the hill from the Ayasofia. Occasionally you can hear the sound of the big ship horns heading into the Straits, and of course the call to prayer, that reminds you where you are, though these should certainly not an obstacle to a wonderful night's sleep. It is clear that this relative newcomer to the Istanbul Hotel scene are very keen to build a good reputation and all their staff share this vision. being more than helpful when required, and friendly throughout. You will be unlikely to get such personal and kind service in a bigger hotel - this place clearly deserves the fine ratings it receives, and will do everything to make sure that it keeps the fine reputation it seems to have already. If you appreciate the good things in life, this must represent very good value for money, and I would happily recommend this place to anyone as a base for exploring the Sultanahmet district and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “"A boutique hotel at its very finest"”
Reviews.Author: Adam H
Reviews.Content: I have experienced few hotels in the world where you can truly arrive as a traveler and leave as a friend. But the amazing hotel staff at Hotel Esans helped achieve this within 4 days, and i look forward to our return visit some day. Each of the rooms are beautifully decorated and uniquely scented, meaning we were always comfortable. The location was so convenient. But most importantly, the Hotel staff went to their very ends to ensure we loved every moment in Istanbul - from recommendations on where to eat, to where to enjoy a true Turkish bath. A special thankyou to Mahir - we hope to see you again soon friend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Megan R
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights and the room was ready as soon as I arrived. The room was beautiful and the lobby made you feel like you were at home. The staff were very helpful and friendly and willing to give you as much information about Istanbul as you needed. The location is very good and a short walk from all major attractions. The hotel is family run and makes you feel very welcome and my stay was very enjoyable. The breakfast is made fresh every morning and there is a large selection to choose from and everything tasted lovely. The hotel is in a nice quiet location and you are able to sleep very well without any noise disturbances. Also there is no traffic outside so it is a safe location for walking. I would definately recommend this hotel to other people and will stay here again when I return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Professional, charming and helpful staff, and a unique hotel”
Reviews.Author: J M
Reviews.Content: I encourage Istanbul first timers to stay here. Close to all main sights in the old city yet located in a quiet street. The street is also full of friendly cats so if you are a cat lover (as we are), you'll get the chance to pet them. The staff here are amazing - welcoming, warm, helpful, and could not do enough for us to ensure our stay was a pleasant one, as well as giving up daily tips on sight seeing or getting around. It was raining heavily during our stay, and they provided us with umbrellas. Airport pick up was easy and well organised. We had no issue with heating or noise as described by one reviewer. Yes the call to prayer at 6.30 am is annoying but that's everywhere, and you soon go back to sleep as the street is quiet. There's a lovely rooftop terrace with views but we couldn't really use it in winter. Breakfast buffet was plentiful and as good as I've had in most 3 star hotels across Europe. Again the staff kept checking if we were happy with it and wanted anything else. Rooms are tastefully decorated with warm colours - noting tacky or mass market in the style. A big thumbs up from us! Incidentally we are a gay couple and we felt very welcome, no raised eyebrows or issues.

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings - good location, but freezing cold in the winter”
Reviews.Author: mec720
Reviews.Content: The location is indeed great - it's just a couple of minutes walk to Aya Sofia and other attractions - but the hotel itself has a couple of significant disadvantages. The room was freezing cold (the A/C couldn't really heat it - the fact the housekeeper left a window open for the entire day didn't really help either). Also, there is no heating in the bathroom so be prepared for freezing temperatures. Floors in the hotel are wooden so if you're not on the top floor, it's VERY noisy and hard to get a good night's sleep (again, the fact that the cleaner threw away my earplugs for no reason didn't help...). Other than that, the staff is extremely helpful and nice, the airport transfer was quick and seamless, and the breakfast (which is included in price) is very good - wide selection of choices, fresh pomegranate/orange juice, and even though in theory it's only served until 10:30am, you can show up at 11 and that's still fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Marrick-7
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is newly refurbished to a high standard. Very good location - easy walk to Topkapi museum, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia (Aya Sofya). Also very close to a lot of restaurants in a safe-feeling district. The staff are very helpful and enthusiastic. Good buffet breakfast with freshly squeezed orange or pomegranate juice. Only negative was that the people in the room above clumped about quite a bit and the wooden floors give little sound protection; but overall an excellent place to stay. A little tip for tourists in Istanbul: If a shoeshine man drops a brush behind him when walking past you or in front of you just ignore it - its not an accident.

Reviews.Title: “Terific location”
Reviews.Author: Caroline_HighGrange
Reviews.Content: Right where you want to be in the historic Sultanhamet district. Restaurants and bars very short distance away. Hotel staff very helpful and thoughtful, nice and clean, large rooms,good buffet breakfast, very comfy after busy days sightseeing, thoroughly enjoyed our stay very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, friendly place to stay for family”
Reviews.Author: Narada1
Reviews.Content: Right in the center of all attractions is this hotel, where you can safely stay and enjoy your stay. The staff at the front desk is phenomenal and very helpful. Our family had 4 members and we had a blast. You will not go wrong with this hotel. Of course if you are picky and do not mind spending lots of money then you have right across four seasons. I feel for budget families you will not go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying with Grandma”
Reviews.Author: mcspicy
Reviews.Content: We were really impressed with Esans. As the other reviews correctly point out, the staff go all out to assist you and to make your stay feel like home. They always offered us coffee when we returned from walking around Istanbul. We stayed over New Year's and they worked very hard to find us a restaurant that was not already booked, not to mention the kind offer of Turkish wine and snacks before our taxi arrived. The location is very central to Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace, but also the tram stop which can take you across the Golden Horn to Beyoglu. The rooms were clean and quiet. I loved the Turkish flavour to the rooms with the paintings and glass mosaic lamps (romantic). We stayed five days so that it started to feel like home. I believe we were a bit sad to leave when we departed. I hope this hotel gets the attention it deserves. There are many others on nearby streets but this just had that extra personal touch.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “great, friendly staff - convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Nol H
Reviews.Content: we were made to feel at home immediately upon arrival, and enjoyed our stay throughout. very convenient location near topkapi palace, aya sofya and the blue mosque. cute rooms, and an extremely friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Family run comortable and cozy hotel minutes from the main hstorical interest sites”
Reviews.Author: Neil M
Reviews.Content: A lovely comfortable hotel only minutes from the main historical interest sites and the busy bustling old city. On arrival we were welcomed with offers of coffee, turkish delight and nuts, the reception even organised delivery of evening dinner from a nearby resturaunt as our arrival was very very late evening. Rooms are clean, comfortable and warm, the location of the hotel on a quiet side street was an added peaceful bonus. The lobby was similar to someone's living room with large TV (usually on BBC World or CNN), bookshelves with city guides and wifi internet/laptops for customer use. Seating was extremely comfortable and the gentle chirruping of the budgies or canaries ( I am not an expert) just added to the relaxing atmosphere. Breakfast was a super array of cold meats, jams, pastries and either scrambled or fried egg. Fresh orange or pomegranite juice was readily available. I was amazed to step outside the hotel and see the walls of the Topkapi Palace and to walk 5 minutes and come to the Hagia Sofia - one of the main reasons for my visit. Everything I wanted to see and do was within a very short walking distance so hotel location was superb. Overall the hotel, its staff and atmosphere added to a great holiday long weekend and I will certainly return as there is still much to do and se in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Homely, friendly, peaceful”
Reviews.Author: Ruby004
Reviews.Content: Esans is a homely hotel, decorated in traditional Turkish style. Comfortable bedrooms, and on a quiet street so no city noise at night. Bliss! The location is fantastic - adjacent to the boundary wall of the Topkapi Palace, so just a few minutes' walk to the entrance, and within 5 mins of Haghia Sophia and Blue Mosque too. But the best thing about the hotel is the hospitality of the staff. Everyone was really welcoming and concerned to be of help... and THANK YOU again for the birthday cake on my son's birthday - it was a lovely surprise!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Hamid O
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, genuinely friendly staff, excellent breakfast, pretty rooms and fast wifi. That's all I can say about this beautiful newly built hotel. They offer a free pickup from the airport and %10 discount on cash payments. Try Mustafa's fresh mixed orange-pomegranate juices in the mornings. absolutely refreshing!

Reviews.Title: “delightful gem..”
Reviews.Author: ajay069
Reviews.Content: Like all reviews, we will not differ... I may not agree with the # 13 rating but can conclude this was a comfortable little gem snugly settled in the very touristy Sultanhamet area. we were committed an arrival transfer and were happy to see the driver waiting for us after a long flight. The drive to the hotel was about 30 minutes . we had an excellent price deal on the hotel and were graciously accorded an upgrade for one of the rooms ( we booked 3). On arrival we were offered hazelnuts and tea/coffee ( a distinct Esans welcome hallmark) and were very graciously introduced to the hotel staff by Engin and Abdullah. The hotel is walking distance to all the touristic sites of Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Sultanhamet square. The tram stop is also around 10-15 minutes walking and takes TL 2 for most tram stations. The area around is dotted with lovely European styled restaurants and a dinner at one of these is highly recommended ( they did offer us group discounts for dinner being off peak season). Breakfast is adequate to good though I would prefer to see more vegetarian options. They did however offer us a special vegetarian spinach borek ( veg spinach puff pastry) on one of our breakfasts. Rooms were adequate size( The superior room was bigger). They also have a terrace on the 4th floor which is great venue for drinks with dinner. Mustafa was a great help with the assistance and what stands out really is the personal touch that they bring into the dealing with clients and are happy to answer all your questions the best they can. regrettably with 5* hotels this is not something that you can experience . So if you are looking for a good , warm and friendly hotel with great prices and close to everything .. this is the place to go.. Highly recommended ******. They do true justice to Turkish hospitality. Tamom....

Reviews.Title: “Homey, family-run comfort in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: beccaboom82
Reviews.Content: Esans is a lovely oasis of calm in the bustling touristy district of the old city. Tucked into a quiet side street (right near a staircase that conveniently leads to a main drag), there's a distinct feeling here of a family-run place. We were greeted with an immediate offer of Turkish delight and hazelnuts with tea and coffee, and Engin and Mustafa were eager to help us with both our bags and finding our way around the city. Rooms here are impeccably clean and decorated in a charming, cozy fashion. Same goes for bathrooms. I constantly marveled at how well-taken-care-of the whole place was. I expected because the hotel is fairly small that breakfast would not be as extravagant as Turkish breakfast usually is, but wrong! There's a lovely array of jams, salads, cheeses, breads/pastries, and there were usually two hot egg dishes every morning. Plus, the absolute best: fresh squeezed pomegranate juice every morning. The lobby feels a bit like a well-worn living room, but there are two laptops for customers' use and a phone where one can make free international calls. All in all, very pleased with our experience and only wish we could have stayed longer! A great balance of being super close/convenient to the major sites in Sultanahmet while maintaining a great feeling of peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “That's a lovely place to stay!...”
Reviews.Author: Motore_Gatta
Reviews.Content: Hello there, We believe Esans Hotel is the best choice people that love to feel the true life of Istanbul can do. An ancient house completely renewed respecting the traditional Turkish style, but must important respecting the traditional hospitality and kindness of this great Country. You feel like home and even better, a nice cup of tea is always ready for you to relax and program your next visit in the big city... And when you step outside, you are under Hagia Sofia and Topkapi Palace... Impossible to stay better, and don't loose the terrace in the morning with a wonderful skyline! THANKS a lot to all the stuff for their kindness and we'll be back as soon as possible!

Reviews.Title: “very charming hotel, location, price”
Reviews.Author: LejlaH
Reviews.Content: Esans is one of the most charming hotels I have ever stayed at. It is located in the old part of Istanbul, just 2 minutes from Topkapi Palace and Sultan Ahmet Square and some of the most important sights in Istanbul. As for the night life, that part of the town is not where you would choose to go, but very reasonable taxi prices in Istanbul, distance from the nightlife areas is not an issue. Upon the entrance you already feel welcome and some special warmth of the place. Each room has its theme. They are absolutely clean, have all you need. Design is really special, combination of the old and modern with a number of details everywhere, but still displayed with taste and in a quantity that will not make you feel overburden with details. Breakfast was really good, with selection of cheese, vegetables, pastries, fresh juice. They even served pancakes to us. Staff is very friendly and helpful, ready to spend time with you giving directions, explaining things or just chatting. When we were leaving they gave us bracelets with blue eye. I found that very charming. Now I have my base in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Next to major sites, clean and good value - highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Naa25
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Ataturk airport at 05.30am and it seemed to be no problem for the check-in staff. The pre-arranged airport pick-up went smoothly and despite the early hour our room was ready and immediately available. Staff were all very helpful and friendly. This place offers value, cleanliness a great location.

Reviews.Title: “good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: KimCanberra
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a lovely surprise. Hidden away from the other hotels, it is close to all the restaurants, markets and tourist attractions in Istanbul. The staff were very helpful, arranged airport transfers for us and an outing to see the whirling dervishes. Engin was very helpful even before we arrived and definitely an asset to the hotel. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday of a Lifetime”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located exactly where you need to be to see all the major sites of importance in Istanbul. The staff, Engin, Abudullah & Cengiz the owner/manager were friendly and could not of done more to make our holiday enjoyable. The hotel was kept in immaculate condition and the breakfast buffet was superb. We stayed for 8 nights and I have no complaints whatsoever. The staff booked travel/ferry trips when asked and were very helpful. The restaurants in the locality were reasonably priced and we recommend the "Turquoise" who were friendly and had great sense of humour. Transport to and from the Airport was great. Our thanks to all the staff. We will certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Attentive and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: shuchigo
Reviews.Content: Like the reviews before mine say, the hotel is excellently located. Close(5-7min walk) to major Sultanahmet attractions and the tram station, but still quiet. Also, their service to guests is very attentive and detailed. We'd booked the hotel a month before with no communication from our end to them about our itinerary. But still, when we reached there at 4PM, the room was ready and we checked-in smoothly. Over apple juice and hazelnuts, we were then explained the walking routes to nearby sights on a very handy Istanbul map. The rooms were good-sized, clean and comfortable. The breakfast buffet was huge and delicious - from fresh fruits to cold cuts to the staple breads. The front desk offers any kind of help willingly. They booked the bus tickets to our next destination, walked us to the pick-up point and also kept our luggage after we checked out till we left. Very pleasant experience, though my only grouse would be that we didn't get a room with a view. I'm not sure if there are rooms upstairs with better views.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and well located Hotel with excellent personal service.”
Reviews.Author: roamers46
Reviews.Content: From the initial booking to even after service this Hotel displayed helpful and friendly service. The Hotel is in a great location, quiet and yet so close to the main attractions and a restaurant precinct that had good quality reasonably priced restaurants. The staff always offered assistance and were happy to book transport and even retrieve my daughters lost hat left in a taxi and then hand deliver it to our Hotel two weeks later. We stayed in the family room, which was large enough for our family of 4 - two teenagers. The feel of the Hotel, as said before in other reviews, is like staying with friendly family members. The decor is simple and the rooms clean. The breakfast was great offering a vast array of Turkish options. The staff offered us breakfast on our early arrival and also organised a selection of morsels when we departed early for a flight 5:30 am. We would recommend this hotel as it made us feel relaxed and welcomed in this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Skyraider
Reviews.Content: Others have said it all really, this is a terrific hotel in an excellent location - less than 5 minutes walk to Topkapi Palace and Haghia Sophia - yet it is just outside the main tourist hotel area and very quiet. The staff are brilliant, from the warmest welcome to helping with any request and displaying a genuine interest in their guests. The breakfast is great, a huge variety of food, I really felt I did not do it justice. Regarding the taxis, my advice is to use public transport when possible - any journey seems to be 2TL and the system is excellent, if a little limited in coverage. I got from Ataturk airport to Esans for 4TL and when I told the hotel this by email they sent me detailed instructions from the nearest tram stop, five minutes walk away (admittedly I got lost, but it was my fault not the instructions). My only negative comment is to say that I agree that the noise from the floor above can be very irritating late at night (yes slippers are provided, but the people above me clearly did not make use of them).

Reviews.Title: “Great staff made this a memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: ReviewerHerts
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights over my birthday weekend - location great, by the walls of Topkapi palace and near Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar etc. But the main asset is the staff, especially Engin and Mostafa, who are incredibly helpful, kind and friendly. When we arrived by taxi from Taksim Square, the meter seemed on the high side at 63 TRY - while we stalled the taxi driver, I quickly asked Engin and Mostafa if the fare seemed correct - let's just say they had a swift word with the driver, and suddenly the meter was 27 TRY! Just be careful about Istanbul taxi drivers - even though they will say 'on the meter', I think some of them have a turbo charge on it!!! After that, the hotel was very helpful in making any arrangements we needed, and double checked fares etc beforehand. They even arranged a surpise cake for me on my birthday, which was a lovely memory. I wouldn't say Istanbul is the prettiest city, but the layers of history are incredible, and if you seek out some local cafes / water pipe cafes and Turkish baths, you can get a glimpse of the real city, away from the inevitable hassle and sales patter of the bazaar, tourist restaurants etc.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite , small hotel with friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Karin G
Reviews.Content: This small (8 rooms I think), exquisite hotel is located on a quite street in the very centre of Istanbul's old city. Having stayed in hotels on five different continents (and in three different hotels in Istanbul) I can say that the staff of Esans is the most helpful and friendliest I've ever met. They cater for your every need. The rooms are beautiful, the breakfast excellent and the location perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Quite a delightful Turkish experience”
Reviews.Author: rmariff
Reviews.Content: We chose to celebrate my birthday in Istanbul with my family flying over from Kuala Lumpur and stayed at Esans Hotel for one week. I made the booking for 3 rooms to accommodate all of us; with different arrival times on the same day. To my understanding as we have 3 rooms booked, we will get 3 complimentary pick up. This was not the case. They only offered 1 complimentary pick up; whilst having to pay for the others. I made an argument that if we have made 3 separate bookings, would they have offered each of us complimentary pick-ups as stated on their website? They didn't answer the question and instead offered a discounted rate of â‚¬19.00 per transfer. It was too late to cancel the reservation. This was my only major gripe about this hotel. The rest are all good. The breakfast, our room [bar the wooden ceiling/floor], cleanliness, helpfullness of the staff and location of the hotel. Our room was on the first floor, the superior room is big and spacious. However you can hear footsteps of the guest on the upper floor as the floor is wooden and the carpet is not thick enough. We were very unlucky for 2 nights when the guest on the top floor was wearing some chunky heeled boots traipsing about the room early in the morning and late at night. Overall it was a good stay, but I do suggest to future guests to make sure you confirm the complimentary airport pick-up if you have more than 1 room booked for different arrivals and request for upper floors room if you are a light sleeper as moi. And they have a little birdie called Sushi, an entertainment for my 4 year old daughter. Istanbul is a breathtakingly beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: pattimae
Reviews.Content: We chose this small hotel based on other Tripadvisor reviews, and we weren't disappointed. It is well located, just around the corner from a very active and noisy street. The hotel is modest, but our room was comfortable and the staff are very friendly and helpful. The morning breakfast was good and when we left on an early tour for Galipoli, they made a point to have something ready for us before we left. The rooftop terrace has a great view of the Bosphorus and there was never anyone else using it. We bought a bottle of wine and enjoyed the sunset. As long as you don't expect a fancy luxury place, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Family Run Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laineysmith
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Esans Hotel on three separate occasions in August/September 2011 for a couple of days each time. The staff were so helpful -even when we had to get up before sunrise to catch our flight. The buffet breakfast that was included in the price was definitely by far the best breakfast I've ever had. We had a standard room which was small, but very nice. Cable television, traditional decor, very clean. For tourists, the location can't be beat - so much to see and do in the area & lots of eateries a few steps away. One word of advice: Hire a yellow cab to get to and from both airports. The shuttle service is not worth it (only marginally cheaper and takes so much longer) and the 'hired cars' at the airport are very overpriced (we made the mistake of choosing the latter options first before trying the yellow cab and concluding it was the way to go). Loved the hotel, would definitely come again.

Reviews.Title: “Turkish delight !”
Reviews.Author: tigerox
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 5 nights in the Esans Hotel, and highly recommend it. Ours was a top floor "superior" room, but others we peeked into on the way up the stairs looked just as nice. From our room, we had a view of the Bosphorus over rooftops, which was a plus, though it's worth mentioning that everyone has access to the rooftop terrace. General description of the hotel: website gives a pretty accurate image. This was a wealthy Ottoman family home, beautifully restored, converted into an 8-room hotel with modern features added: automatic lights in the staircase, air conditioner (individual controls), in-room safe, mini-bar, small flat-screen TV, modern shower, etc. And everything works! Location: hard to imagine better. Literally only a couple of minutes walk to Topkapi, Saint Sophie, etc. Also easy walk to tram stop "Sultanahmet" with modern trams passing every few minutes to take you to other neighborhoods. Tram is really easy to use, but if you prefer taxis, there's a taxi stand just around the corner - front desk can call a taxi for pickup in less than 2 minutes. Hotel is located on a street with no through traffic - just access to a small parking lot, used only during the daytime when tourist sites are open - no cars at night. Plenty of restaurants just around the corner. Neighborhood is absolutely safe, even late at night. Room: spacious, bright, well-appointed. Bed is large (180cm) and comfortable. Everything is spotlessly clean - towels are changed daily. Breakfast: buffet style with both Turkish and "western" selections. Among other things, fresh- squeezed orange juice, fresh-brewed coffee. Noise: A light sleeper in our party said he heard some cars passing on the nearby Ishakpasa Avenue - but in such a dense area, it's hard to get completely away from all nocturnal activity. By comparison, many of the other hotels of the same category are much less well situated - directly on such avenues, some even on the avenue with the tram going by! At least Esans is tucked away on a small side-street. As for the call to prayer mentioned in some earlier posts, it can be heard everywhere in Istanbul (that's the point!), and frankly it's not so awful. Besides, it comes so early in the morning, it really isn't a problem to go back to sleep. Business/money matters: We made our reservation through the hotel website, so handled by "Reseliva" - all went without a hitch, and we promptly received a confirmation email from Esans directly. Free airport pickup was well organized, and much appreciated. On checkout, we chose to pay cash for a 5% discount (easy to do with ATM's widely available). Hotel staff/services: a handful of young men take turns at reception. They each have a different personality, but all are incredibly eager to please - ready to do whatever they can to make your stay more enjoyable - offering tips about public transportation, restaurant recommendations, answering any kind of question, trying to find a solution to any problem. (An example, among many: there's a computer in the reception lounge for guests, but it's not hooked up to a printer, so they let us use the hotel computer to print our boarding passes). The human contact with these delightful young men was one of the highlights of our trip. So there you have it - another rave review for the Esans hotel. Hope you enjoy your stay as much as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it all - I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: All-Year-Round
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Esans Hotel last month for 6 nights (sorry only getting round to the review now) and I have to say it was great. This was my first time in Istanbul and I was unsure as to where to stay as I was on my own. After reading many reviews I decided to go for Esans and I was not disappointed. The location was perfect. It's literally 10 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and a range of shops and restaurants. The free airport pickup took the pain out of finding the hotel. It is a small - only 8 rooms - but it is just perfect for a relaxing stay. The staff were great. They all took time out to speak to you and where always on hand to help with any questions or queries I had. The room was quaint but a good size and it was spotless. There was little view from the room itself but there was a rooftop terrace where you could sit and see the sea. To be honest when I had been out all day, it didn't really bother me to have a view or not as I just relaxed in the room. Breakfast was a range of traditional foods and breads and if you wanted something that wasn't there they were only too happy to arrange that for you. There is no restaurant in the hotel but as I mentioned before it is just around the corner of many restaurants. I would have stayed an extra night only it was fully booked so I had to move. The hotel I moved to was more expensive and didn't come close to Esans. I'd definitely stay in Esans again if I was to return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: fkmAtlanta
Reviews.Content: Our family of four spent five nights at the Esans and can affirm all of the positive reviews we read about it on Tripadvisor. The rooms were spacious and clean, the breakfasts were excellent, and the staff went out of its way to make us happy. As a matter of fact, we were actually walked to our restaurants on the first two nights of our stay!

Reviews.Title: “A great Hotel for historical sites and fabulous breakfasts!”
Reviews.Author: kiwibear
Reviews.Content: Great service, always ready to help, lovely rooms, ours was a little small. At breakfast there was a typical Turkish spread but here there was fabulous choice with everything being very fresh for Istanbul. They also have a fab chef who cooks different things each day such as the finest pancakes and wonderful omlettes etc The hotel is so well placed for the sites it could not be better. Engin was so good he even offered to take us on his day off to some sites. The night staff were also very helpful. It was expensive but considering where it is the price is understandable. Another lovely touch was the wine or tea they brought us if we happened to be in during the day, at no extra charge!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: rosemary t
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here after a 2 week bus tour of Turkey . It was a perfect place to spend our last 3 days in Turkey. The rooms were large and tastefully decorated.. As there was no lift the staff carried our suitcases to our room..it is in a very handy position to all the attractions . The staff were very helpful and nothing was too much trouble .I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An adorable gem in the heart of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: spycygrl
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night here, but wish we would have stayed more. Possibly one of the best values in the old city, honestly! This was the first night of our honeymoon in Turkey and Greece and the entire staff of the Esans made us feel special and welcome! From the moment we booked (via booking.com), we had good communication with the staff -- we arranged an airport pickup through the hotel and they were waiting for us at international arrivals without issue! Upon arrival at the hotel, we met Engin (with his fancy haircut!) and were presented with a couple of glasses of Turkish sweet wine and some Turkish Delight while our check-in was processed. Our bags were taken up the stairs to our room (which was on the first floor -- street level), Dervish Odour room. All rooms in the hotel are named for scents ("Esans" must mean "essence" in Turkish, I think). The room was a good size and very attractively appointed. It was, in fact, in the same color palette as our wedding -- Tiffany blue and brown! The bed was a bit firm, but the pillows were cushy. Just after checking in, the staff brought us up a little plate of fruit as a "welcome." I don't know if they do that for everyone or if it was special for our honeymoon. It was lovely. The bathroom and shower were very nice (with decent water pressure) and the A/C worked beautifully. The hotel is in the middle of everything and the staff truly goes out of their way to please. We asked for a restaurant recommendation and were sent to Tria (about 1 block away) which was gorgeous, romantic (rooftop restaurant with a view of the Bosphorus and the Blue Mosque) and only about $50 USD for 2 people with wine. In the morning, the breakfast buffet was fabulous -- plates of meats, cheeses, eggs, olives, tomatoes, plus yogurt and toast. A huge spread...far better than what we got at other more expensive hotels on our trip! We were awakened by the call to prayer at 5:00 a.m. As mentioned, it's quite loud (even with the A/C fan running), but it was really beautiful, too and we, honestly, didn't mind. We later stayed in a different hotel at the end of our trip which was twice the price and, while pretty glamourous, doesn't beat the Esans for value. I would recommend this hotel to EVERYONE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Esans!”
Reviews.Author: Leesh77
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is a great city, and the Esans is the perfect place to stay to enjoy it. I booked the Esans hotel based on the comments on Trip Advisor, and my group couldn't have been happier. From the moment we arrived, and they met us outside at our cab to get our luggage -- we felt right at home at the Esans. Why it is so great: -- The staff is incredibly friendly and willing to help you out with anything you need. Snacks, tea, directions, reccomendations, car arrangements, anything! More than once we were asked, "do you need anything else to make your stay enjoyable?" For dinner, we asked for suggestions, and they walked us to the restaurant to make sure we found it! They were also really great about holding our bags after we checked out. We had a late flight, and they not only took care of our luggage while we explored Istanbul in the morning, but when we returned back to get our luggage - they offered us tea and snacks, called a cab for us, carried all of our luggage out...AND gave us a little gift when we left! Love the Esans! -- The rooms are adorable. For what you are paying, the value is excellent. Each room is decorated differently, with a boutique-feel. Spacious, clean... Bed was comfy. Air-Conditioning works well, and can be adjusted to your liking. Bathrooms are modern and roomy, and I know this is minor - but they have huge towels! ( I love huge towels). There is also a safe and a mini bar in each room. There is free wifi in the entire hotel, and a computer in the lobby that anyone can use. One note: they do not have 120 V outlets, you will need an adapter. Outlets are the typical two pronged round "Europlug". -- The location is ideal, and close to everything you would want to see in Sultanhamet. Steps from Topkapi Palace, and another 5 minute walk to the Blue Mosque, and the Hagia Sophia. Also, there is a taxi stand right around the corner - so if you need a cab called, it literally takes about 2 minutes for it to arrive in front of the hotel. -- Great roof terrace that looks out over the sea. You can enjoy your breakfast up there...which they are more than happy to carry up for you! (There is no elevator.) Breakfast is a great selection of pastries, yogurt, eggs, cheeses - more than enough to fill you up! (...and if you are not adventurous - there are Cocoa Puffs.) There is nothing bad I can say about this place. It has a really "great bed and breakfast" feel, and if you want to experience Turkish hospitality at it's best - The Esans Hotel is where you want to go...I will definitely be back! (I actually wish I was there now!)

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: mandurahtraveller
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after seeing it on Trip Advisor. The location was great, walking distanced to all the sights. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom super clean. We were welcomed with apple tea and local delicacies. The buffet breakfast had plenty of choice and the hotel staff were very helpful. Air conditioned too. Only downside was the early morning call for prayers from the loudspeaker on the local mosque, but you would hear this wherever you stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: MartaRT
Reviews.Content: Great location, excellent service, friendly staff and clean rooms . We'll definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Turkish hospitality at its best”
Reviews.Author: brixham
Reviews.Content: One of the reasons we chose this hotel was because of its efficient website and the way they dealt with our booking.It did not disappoint.After a smooth transfer from airport [remember to buy visa before immigration!] a wonderful welcome from the staff.Our room on top floor was large and tastefully decorated in Turkish style with views over the Bosphorus-and spotlessly clean.Each morning we had breakfast [brought upstairs by the willing staff] on the roof terrace.We walked to most sights but the tram is easy to use and within a minute's walk there is a street of good restaurants and cafes . This was our second visit to Istanbul-having stayed last year at an impersonal larger 'chain' hotel--this one we would certainly return to.

Reviews.Title: “A stay to remember”
Reviews.Author: MoeLeb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Esans hotel for 4 great nights and the stay was super. The hotel's location is perfect as it's at a walking distance from major Istanbul monuments and close to tram station where you can reach elsewhere. Off the street you can find all kinds of cafe, restaurants and shops. Food is great anywhere in Istanbul. The hotel staff are great and very friendly; they would do anything to ensure your stay is enjoyable. I highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there when I revisit Istanbul. Thanks a lot Ibo, Abduallah, Dawlet and Engin for making my stay a wonderful one.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden New Hotel in Centre”
Reviews.Author: Fenny G
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have decided to stay at Hotel Esans after visiting their lovely website and check the reviews. It was a real great choice. Such lovely hotel with full of elegancy and very attentive staff. It is not like an official hotel much more like a traditional house with the way receptions and waiters treat you. We had to leave very early for Pegarsus airlines flight to home. The staff offered us having quick breakfast at 05:45am in the morning with a nice coffee. They do not let us leave without breakfast. So we did not have to eat at airport or at flight which I really dislike. Highly Recommending the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel”
Reviews.Author: jogetnog
Reviews.Content: A small humanly run hotel perfectly situated in Sultanamet, within walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Topkapi, Agia Sophia, the Grand Bazaar and the Spice Market. A very attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Super 3 Star with Plusses and Slight Minuses”
Reviews.Author: TallyHo25
Reviews.Content: As stated elsewhere, this is a small, very clean and friendly hotel within walking distance of the "big three" sights: Topkapi, Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. It also has a wondeful rooftop terrace with great views. (This was advertised as where one had breakfast. Yes, the management said, they would bring your breakfast tray up there if you wished, but it's not their normal breakfast location.) The staff is indeed very friendly and accomodating. Don't count on perfect English however -- with the result that you may not always get what you think you've requested even though they're trying like mad to provide what you want. The rooms are large. We did book the family room - to make sure we had a large room - although we later saw that many of the other rooms are equally comfortable (and air conditioned). The bathrooms are clean (but bring your own washcloth). And the Wi-Fi worked well. Its location is good but to get back from some locations in Istanbul can be quite difficult because although there's a taxi rank only as block and a half away for getting to the center of town, very few cab drivers can find the location coming back. Be sure and get written instructions from the front desk as you depart anywhere. Note that our friends, who stayed longer than we did, discovered after we left that there is a very simple one-stop train that works beautifully to get to, say, the Spice Market. But we weren't told about that by the front desk. There is no elevator so be warned you may have as much as a three flight walk-up, especially if you book the family room. Summary, if you are even a little bit adventurous and you want to be in the historic Sultanahmet district, the Esans Hotel is a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: USCtraveller
Reviews.Content: This is a small boutique hotel very close to the Sultanahmet area. The rooms are large with small flatscreen TV, nice closet with a safe and a nice bathroom. The best aspects of this hotel are the very helpful staff and close location to the old town tourist sites (Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia). The breakfast is very good, with plenty of choices, and they will freshly squeeze orange juice for you. You can choose to eat your breakfast in the ground floor lobby or on the rooftop with a beautiful view of the sea. Unfortunately, the hotel does not have an elevator so it can be a bit of a haul to upper bedrooms or the rooftop terrace. The hotel is located next to a parking lot so you can hear some noise from the street, particularly if you are in one of the lower rooms. Overall a good budget choice where you will receive excellent service from the staff and a terrific place to explore all of the outstanding sites of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent homely feel”
Reviews.Author: TJ_in_Manchester
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my parents in July 2011, on my way to Singapore from England. The most outstanding thing was the friendliness and homeliness of the staff. The rooms were good, no doubt, but it was the staff that won over our hearts, especially their respectful and helpful attitude towards elderly people. The hotel is a short walk to the beach, and also walking distance to the Blue Mosque. Their pick up service from the airport was reliable, and everything proceeded without any glitches. Breakfast in the morning is enough to keep you going for the day. To take taxis ask the hotel staff to call them for you, otherwise some taxi drivers rip you off.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel with Interesting Services”
Reviews.Author: anomni
Reviews.Content: Free sellected aroma/essence in room. Free international phone call from lobby everynight.. The location cant be beaten. Very silent street with minutes walking to important places. The room was OK with tastefully decorated. The breakfast was great with health and fresh food. The guys working done best to make us comfortable. I had forgotten my camera charger. They provided me in the second day even it was difficult to find that old one. Once again thank you for making our stay wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel and would stay again here again.”
Reviews.Author: evelyne_2011
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel by chance, having arrived to Istambul without reservations, we just took to metro to Sultanahmet and looked for hotels, another hotel refered it to us. The standard rooms we chose was nicely decorated and very clean, the bed was very good, bathroom was new, and we had a view to the sea. The hotel offers free of charge to put an aroma of your preference in the room, which we declined. The terrace has an spectacular sea view and to Aya Sophia. It is within walking distance of all major attractions. Staff was very helpful and tried to their fullest to accomodate our needs. Breakfast buffet is really good, however if you want to have it in the terrace you have to take it up yourself. They have transportation to the aiport by bus at set times, or private service. We preferred to take took a cab for 35 TLY, which is more convenient. We highly reccomend it, and definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: GerryAtlanta
Reviews.Content: The staff are really friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and enjoyed my stay. Definitely staying here when I come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Harrier19
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Turkey and knew very little about Istanbul. We chose to stay in the old part of the city and chose this hotel based on reviews on Trip Advisor. We weren't disappointed, our room was a bit small but very clean and comfortable. This is a family run business and they made us feel very welcome. From here we were able to walk over the Golden Horn Bridge all the way up to Taksum Square, so the location was ideal. Many thanks for a great stay, hope to come back and stay again sometime in the near future, we loved the city and the Turkish people were so friendly, even the pushy carpet sellers!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: amp-qld
Reviews.Content: We stay at Esans in the Lavender Room in June and the Odours (maybe perfume would be a better translation) Room in July. The first room is a little bit small but very quiet while the latter is large and very pleasant but a little bit noisier. The staff were really helpful on both stays. The hotel is within a couple of hundred metres of the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque and the Yerebatan Cistern.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Tibohine
Reviews.Content: Great location within easy walking distance important attractions. Friendly, family run hotel. Comfortable, clean rooms, quiet, excellent breakfast and roof terrace with view of the Bosphorous. Highly recomment Esans to the discerning customer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a convenient location - great for families.”
Reviews.Author: PiazInCr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Esans Hotel for 5 nights in June 2011. We are a family of 4, 2 adults and 2 teens. We stay on the 2nd floor in one of the family rooms. This hotel has many wonderful qualities: 1. Most important are the 4 guys that work in the hotel. You could not ask for friendlier and hardworking hotel staff. From the moment they greeted us until our last day, we were impressed with their friendliness, caring and attention to detail. On 2 occasions they walked us to our destination rather than just give us directions. 2. The location is perfect for the old city. It's walking distance to the Sea of Marmara, Hagia Sophia, The Blue Mosque, the tram stop, fun restaurants, shops and Topkopi Palace. 3. Clean, nicely decorated rooms with a reasonably sized bathroom. 4. Great breakfast with variety 5. Rooftop deck with great views of the sea. 6. AC in the room 7. They helped us book a Turkish bath, a belly dancing show and made dinner reservations. Go stay here - you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great lttle hotel very helpful,friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mikeandlynne_11
Reviews.Content: We liked the small family run hotel. Our room 303 had a great view over the Bosphorus. Also has good views from roof terrace. Well placed for all transport links, plenty of local restaurants. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a superb quiet area of Sultanahmet in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: jajben
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at Esans hotel in a twin superior room on the top floor with a view of the Marmara Sea. We enjoyed our stay here very much and were impressed with the homely service and the warm hospitality. Our room was spacious and comfortable. The hotel is in a quiet area alongside the old city walls that line the Topkapi Palace, with a metro station close by and a street full of restaurants nearby. The Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace are within easy walking distance behind the hotel, so the location is very convenient. This was our first visit to Istanbul and we were very pleased to have stayed at Esans Hotel. Our pleasant stay there made our entire trip to Istanbul a fantastic experience as we could retreat to a home from home after a busy day exploring the city. We will definitely return to this hotel and recommend it to our friends if they are travelling to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: DelhiDip
Reviews.Content: We normally stay in 5 star hotels and had initial reservations about booking a 'small' hotel but found our stay at the Esans to be just as enjoyable. In fact, it was probably better than a 5 star hotel due to the sincerity and hospitality of the staff. Every staff member was friendly, genuine and made efforts to ensure that all your needs were answered. The staff made the stay truly enjoyable! The rooms meet all your basic needs and are immaculately clean. The simple buffet breakfast is authentic and is more than enough, especially with the wonderful fresh squeezed orange juice. We loved the location which is on a quiet side street, steps from the main tourist road. We plan to visit Istanbul again and would definitely choose to stay at the Esans again.

Reviews.Title: “It Was What Were Looking For”
Reviews.Author: AlBrian54
Reviews.Content: Been in Istanbul with our two kids. We had always wanted our children to be social and be friends with local people during our trips.Esans Hotel was great choice. The staff is doing best to make you feel like guest in their home. They go out from their standard way to meet our requirements with smiling face. Especially this staff deserve to be one of best in Istanbul. Our children liked them a lot and the small blue bird in reception. The family room was very spacious and romanticly decorated. Breakfast was more than what we were expecting. The terrace is wonderfull. Especially fantastic location. Minutes away to all important places.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: valgardening
Reviews.Content: We decided to visit this hotel for our stay in Istanbul based on the other reviews and we certainly were not disappointed. The staff could not have been more helpful and friendly, the breakfast was amazing for a small hotel, such a variety and quantity. The rooms are all decorated in a different traditional theme, we had the 'lavendar odour' and the situation couldn't be better for all the most important sights. In all I really believe this to be probably the best hotel in Istanbul if you want something small, friendly, spotlessly clean and near the sights. If you want something large and impersonal don't come here, leave the rooms free for the more discerning!

Reviews.Title: “A Real Homey Traditional House Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kingtraveller23
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is amazing. The hotel Esans in the Old Town of Istanbul made our stay really more comfortable and entertaining. The staff was very friendly. They want us to feel like home instead of a official hotel atmosphere. The rooms are very new and well decorated. The breakfast was very tasty. Their wonderfull restaurants and museum hints made us spend great time with Esans Hotel. Especially see their nice terrace and get a drink there.

Reviews.Title: “Most friendly staff in Istambul and excellent localization.”
Reviews.Author: ThyagoMathias
Reviews.Content: This small hotel in Sultanamet is located just a 5 minutes walk from Hagia Sophia and the entrance of Topkapi Palace. Everything was absolutely clean and the staff were really helpfull to find me the best things to do there, at anytime. Simple but honest breakfest.

Reviews.Title: “Will not forget at all”
Reviews.Author: HamiltonBross32
Reviews.Content: We have choosen not to make any reservation in advance before going to sultanhmet old city of Istanbul. A bit risky but all went perfect and we found Esans Hotel on foot. It was busy season. This Hotel is new so we could find the last double room. The location is very good. We could walk in minutes to Saint soffia and sea side. My friend enjoyed running through marmara sea every morning. The staff is very friendy and elegant. Provided us very usefull information. Even we could discover traditional bean restaurant and local etnical concert with their help. the breakfast is very delicous. The rooms are very nice and clean.It is a perfect place to stay especially you like to feel more friendly homey atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, friendly staff and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: bobbingtonbelle
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Esans were extremely friendly and very helpful . The location was perfect for seeing the sights in the centre of Istanbul, most were within walking distance. The room was very clean and comfortable and if we return to Istanbul we would stay there again. All in all, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, good value, well run boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: anderson1959
Reviews.Content: Esans was a real find. It's perfectly located for the main sites in Sultanhamet and is run by friendly, helpful and obliging staff who try really hard to make sure you have a good time. There is a street full of good value and good quality restaurants just behind the hotel and Aya Sofia is a 5 minute walk away. The rooms are tastefully decorated each in an individual style and they have tried hard to make it a different experience. We followed our stay here with a 2 week tour around Turkey, and Esans compared well to most of the hotels we stayed in and is certainly better than the standard 'business' hotels around the city. They provide a good breakfast and are very willing to help you with information about where to go in the city. The rooms are very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “What a Nice Find In Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: SkipperTravel
Reviews.Content: Once again I am very happy to see internet advantages. We would never find such hidden treasure in Istanbul without it. The staff call the Hotel as Traditional Welcoming House. Unbelievable hospitable,so warm,so helpful staff. My little girl liked the small bird in the lobby a lot. They even gave some gifts to her and she did like them much. The room was very big and romanticly decorated. The restaurants that they proposed were also nice. The breakfast was great with choices for us and our little daughter. So happy to meet and stay with them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience in Old City Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Frelinda43
Reviews.Content: My overall stay was great.It was my first time in Istanbul.So authentic and nice people. Especially the Esans hotel was my nearly first close touch with a Turkish family. The right one for me to know the meet Turkish traditions and culture. So warm atmosphere. They do best to accommodate you.The rooms is very superb. So new and smells like fresh. The breakfast is very good. The location was perfect. The staff never ends smiling and offering you many things. I will send my parents in july to the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy family friendly hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: aussie-ando
Reviews.Content: Excellent (helpful) staff and central location of hotel. The airport-hotel pickup service was efficient and welcome after our long flight from Australia. Cengiz, Engin & staff at Esans gave unbiased advice about local shopping, ferry trips and major sites of interest. Breakfast was always a healthy and was a combination of Turkish & traditional foods. The freshly squeezed orange juice was delicious! We spent 8 days in istanbul and would return to the Esans again. Make sure you visit the roof garden for photographs over the Marmara Sea.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well located, driven by very helpfull and friendly staf”
Reviews.Author: Daniel_Barreto
Reviews.Content: Very confortable room, larger and better than what looks on picture. Very clean, soft bed, spacious. Well located near Sultanahmed and AyiaSofia. Excelent pickup service. The breakfast room are small if all guests wakeup at the same time. Very friendly and concerned staff. Definetely recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: traveltraveltravel
Reviews.Content: Very civilised, compact hotel very close to the Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia. Clean and comfortable rooms. Nice breakfast with good range of options. Highlight of the hotel is the staff. Very friendly and welcoming. Nothing seemed to be too much trouble. Would certainly recommend to friends looking for a city break in Istanbul (Sultanahmet area).

Reviews.Title: “Unlimited Hospitality & Smile”
Reviews.Author: KREG_GO
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small but very cute one. It is understandable that decoration and details are handled very carefully and with a nice tastefully design. I guess it is very new Hotel in the area. Room is kept very clean, staff does the best to make you feel comfortable. They follow up the festivals, concerts and try to learn our interests to offer relative attractions in Istanbul where we can never find without their help. We had a very nice sufi spiritual concert in basilica cistern in the night with their help. So amusing and very different atmosphere. Do not forget to visit basilica cistern in the night. The breakfast was very nice with tasty delicious kind of food. They serve also fresh squeezed orange juice and fresh filter coffee which is a bit exceeding my breakfast expectation for such small hotel. Theere is no elevator in the hotel. it is a wooden kind of building. If you expect an five star big hotel environment, I guess it is not your type however I would definitely highly recommending.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located with wonderfully friendly and charming staff.”
Reviews.Author: DavidHH024
Reviews.Content: The family/staff went out of their way to recommend restaurants, organise taxis, etc. and when one of the family , a musician, learned that I play the guitar he found us a brilliant jazz guitar trio in a small intimate club. It was brilliant. Can't recommend them enough. David Harris

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality and friendly advice gave us a truly varied picture of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: evielNicosia_Cyprus
Reviews.Content: Lovely gracious people. Great location and they arrange for reasonably priced, efficient airport transport.. My room was large and comfortable, with heating and hot water in shower. Herb tea was given to us after a day of wandering the town. Two laptops were available for guests to use. Their recommendations on restaurants from the local 'meatball' institution at 10 lira per portion, to a roof top prime location in the Galata area, approx 30 lira per portion, were superb. It was great to wake up every morning and be greeted with such enthusiasm.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York City, New York, USA
Reviews.Title: “Convienent, Friendly, Reasonable.”
Reviews.Author: Kepeli69
Reviews.Content: The convenience of the Esans to major attractions turned out to be a huge advantage and allowed us to take our time to explore the different historical sites. Not only is the location terrific, the street is very quiet at night and there never any heavy road traffic (which is great b/c there are some huge buses going up/down some other streets very close). There is a main street 1.5 blks away with bars/hostels (very lively) with some of the other hotels we looked and we would not have been nearly as happy. The service is great and bfast more than ample. My girlfriend's bday was during our trip and when the staff found out, they surprised her with a bday cake from a local bakery...very thoughtful and on the house. When they found out the wi-fi was not strong enough in our room (3rd floor) they set up a separate router in our room which then also gave us access to wi-fi on the roof (4th floor). The room was a double which was fine but there were not really any usable drawers and the room was not comfortable to relax in (but we are 6'4" and 5'10" respectively). If you are planning on spending any time in the room, get a Superior. Water-pressure was fine and the shower (though small) has a head that goes higher than most I have seen traveling. Other guests seemed to be primarily English, Canadian, Australian, American

Reviews.Title: “nice stay, good location”
Reviews.Author: CottonHair
Reviews.Content: rooms nice, breakfast buffet very good. Would have liked to have used the terrace, but they had nothing set up there. (it was November) - they said they were going to do something with it in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location with Very Attentive Staff”
Reviews.Author: GFrenky
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect. Stayed for four nights with two friends. Room had a perfect decoration, ideal for relaxing and sleep. Location couldn't be better. Lots of restaurants right on the doorstep. Saint Sophia Topkapi palace and Blue Mosque are very near to Hotel. Staff were helpful and attentive. Overall very impressed, I must say.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in the heart of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: TravelinR0se
Reviews.Content: Engin and the staff greeted welcomed us on arrival and made sure we felt comfortable finding our way around Istanbul. From the usual concierge duties to some extra requests, Engin rose to the occasion and never disapointed. Our room was on the top floor, and there were no stairs, though small, the room was comfortable and we enjoyed our time there. We would stay again on another visit.

Reviews.Title: “A home from home in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: sallybyrne
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at Esans Hotel we were made to feel incredibly welcome.
