Engin our concierge was so warm and friendly and took pains to explain how to get to the tourist sites and even recommended some of his favourite walks and restaurants. The hotel is only a stone's throw away from the Blue Mosque in the historic old town but is set back from the main tourist drag, on a quiet street, ideal for a restful nights' sleep! The rooms are clean, modern and nicely decorated in ottoman style. Breakfast is substantial, with cheese, cold meats and omelette, perfect to set you up for a long day of sight seeing. I would not hesitate to recommend Hotel Esans to anyone travelling to Istanbul. Indeed, we hope to return one day and will, of course, be staying at Hotel Esans!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in a beautiful city.”
Reviews.Author: mafarfOrvieto
Reviews.Content: While checking out some recommended hotels from friends, I found Esans Hotel online. What a find! The attention to detail, from the booking to paying was excellent. The staff was very friendly and, welcoming. Being a small boutique and family owned hotel, there was a feeling of comfort and casualness. The location is in a quiet area, close to the Hagia Sophia and other historically significant sites. The rooms are very nice, spacious, and soon the roof top terrace will be complete which will offer nice views of the Hagia Sophia and the sea. Last but not least, the breakfast buffet is wonderful with a wide array of choices from scrambled eggs, various breads, cereals, yogurts, meats and cheeses and many traditional Turkish options. Thanks Engin and staff for a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Positione Very Colorful Rooms”
Reviews.Author: DONZELLO
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has great positione very near to Torpkapi Museum and Sain Sophia. Everywhere is on foot or by tramway. The room was very big and colorfully decorated. Cleaning lady is very carefull to tidy up the room every day. The room was always fresh when we arrive. Especially the reception has very nice recommendation. Breakfast was very nice. There is no lift. It may be difficile for disable people. The rest of the hotel amenties are perfect. Do not forget to watch sun set from the Terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Staff”
Reviews.Author: Jimmony45
Reviews.Content: It is really joy to announce the most friendliest team I have ever seen in hotels we have stayed. Most probably because it is a small charming hotel plus a turkish hospitaliy tradition. You are treated like one of family member. Helped alot for a perfect personal sightseeing itinary in istanbul based on weather forecast.Very artistic,spacious and authetico room. The lady made very delicious krepes during breakfast. The coffee was nice with soft aroma.All satisfied alot.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifico Location Great House”
Reviews.Author: greg29j
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel in centre of istanbul sultanahmet oldcity. Very near to saint sofhia, mosqeo blue. In contrario, the hotel is very silent street. Very nice Turkish family managing with very close interest. It is like a house with good amenties.Big rooms and good breakfast. Very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice and welcoming atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: GrehorHain
Reviews.Content: Even I insisted on staying in bigger star Hotel in Istanbul, my wife got me for selecting this small hotel in old city Istanbul. In the end, I was very happy to stay there and meet with owners and Turkish friendly hospitality. The hotel was in a very central location to shops, restaurants and museums. By walking, you can get to all of the major attractions from here. We did. We loved the style of the room decor (very contemporary as well as traditional motives) and the views from our rooms was great sea view. Family kind of atmosphere makes you feel different. Again Trip Advisor helped a lot for staying and eating in right place. I'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Real Enjoyable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steinhur23
Reviews.Content: We had an enjoyable stay for three nights in Istanbul old city. We are experienced international travelers and prefer local kind of accommodations rather than more touristic places. The Esans Hotel is a jewel hidden in central old city Istanbul. Only walking to all cultural places with a silent sleep in the night,think of it. Rooms are very nice and elegant. Very clean. Each room has a dedicated essence name. We were in room Cariye which has also fragrance in lobby. We enjoyed breakfast with especially nice pasteries and fresh orange juice also nice filter coffee. The management and staff treated us like dear old friends and we are looking forward to our next stay there in June this year.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel with Attentive Staff”
Reviews.Author: emilychapman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this lovely hotel right in the heart of Sultanahmet for the last 4 days of my honeymoon and it was absolutely PERFECT! The daily breakfast was wonderful and we got wonderful advice from the front desk for places to go. And our top floor rom was everything I expected. The pictures were spot on! The view from our room was awesome too. Their helper Zolkan so kindly brought all of our luggage and took it all down. I would highly recommend anyone visiting Istanbul to stay at this hotel. It was the perfect way for my husband and I to end our honeymoon. Thanks for the beautiful memories. :) Emily & David Chapman

Reviews.Title: “feel at home in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: AnjaundBernd
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights during a very cooold long weekend. But Engin and the team made our stay worthwhile. Great tips on what to do and where to go, reservations for everything at short notice (and even a tour guide we got through a personal contact did not know any better) and an absolute pleasant environment in a cozy hotel in a top location. We cannot wait to go there again when it is warm and we can sit on the roof terrace!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, friendly hotel set in the heart of Sultanahmet.”
Reviews.Author: Jayogold
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Esans and couldn't recommend it highly enough. Great value and location and English spoken. Engin was extremely helpful with his suggestions on what to do, where to eat etc. We had a fantastic weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location; large, clean rooms; complete breakfast; but there is room for improvement.”
Reviews.Author: MonctonCanucks
Reviews.Content: It is very well situated, within walking distance of all major attractions in Sultanahmet. The exterior of the building is unprepossessing and there is much construction going on all around it. Front desk staff is friendly and willing to help, but many of the students who work there simply did not have the knoweldge to answer our questions. The breakfast buffet is complete, but the breakast room is cozy with limited natural daylight since it is in a half-basement. Coffee is instant, but the fresh orange juice helps to compensate. The one area which they need to improve would be the quality of their bedding. For example, we had a king size bed with a queen size synthetic duvet, and there were only two pillows in the room, and they were not of not good quality. Both these facts prevented us for having good night sleeps.

Reviews.Title: “Personal, accomodating, and right next to everything!”
Reviews.Author: JonandSusan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul, about a five minute walk from the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque. From the beginning, the staff were extremely helpful and did whatever they could to ensure my wife and I enjoyed our stay. They serve breakfast every morning, made up of bread, cheeses, jams, fruits, a couple of egg scrambles, and more. Tea and fresh squeezed orange juice was always waiting for us when we woke up and went downstairs. There's a rooftop terrace with a beautiful view. One of the staff members told me they're going to use it for breakfast in the summer time. The room was warm and had everything we needed. Only issue we had was on the first night and involved noisy upstairs neighbors. The walls aren't too thick so if someone above you is loud, you'll hear it. The location was perfect. Only a few minutes walk to the main historic sites, and the backpacker district with plenty of great restaurants and bars is even closer.

Reviews.Title: “A personal hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelprince2345
Reviews.Content: I had chosen this hotel in Istanbul based on the fine reviews I read here on tripadvisor, I was very much pleased with my decision to do so. My brother, mother and I stayed here for one night last week. I will first say that "Engie", the receptionist was a pure joy and added to our stay. He gave us personal service and went out of his way to make us comfortable. The room itself has very artistic decor and the hotel overall is very clean being less then a year old. Location is excellent. 5-10 walk to Blue mosque/Sultanahmet tram spot which takes u to main sites. Keep in mind though. From the hotel, the street that goes this area is a very intense hill so just those people who have issues with mobility. I would keep this in mind. Also, the view from the roof of the hotel is wonderful with the Sea of Marmar visible in front of your eyes. Breakfast was light, yet much to choose from. Plus they served fresh orange juice as well. Only issue I had was that the floors in the room were hardwood. We were staying on the 2nd floor, and the guest from the room above us came home late and I woke up from their walking around, but otherwise room is truly spacious and excellent. Also of note, shower/bathroom clean plus both 120/240 electrical ports were in the room. Huge for me being from USA. Overall excellent stay especially for the price. 3 single beds for 73 euros! I would defintely recommend this hotel. The stay was more fulfilling then a brand hotel. Enjoy the trip!

Reviews.Title: “Rejuvenation in the heart of Sultanahmet!”
Reviews.Author: dianaharp
Reviews.Content: Sultanahmet is the main historical area of Istanbul, with loads of sites and sounds packed into a tiny area. Esans is super conveniently located yet also extremely quiet and private. It's perfect place to recover from all the walking and seeing, and helps you appreciate the city even more. The staff is great, most speaking excellent English (unfortunately I speak no Turkish), and very sensitive to the needs of all the different types of travelers they encounter. The room are beautiful, clean, and breakfast was plentiful, seeing us through to a late lunch every day. You can't go wrong with Esans.

Reviews.Title: “Family atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Kacak
Reviews.Content: Esans is a really nice place in the centre. Beautiful spaceful and clean rooms, extremely pleasant and friendly staff, nice view and great terrase for breakfast. The hotel is small but cosy. Family atmosphere. I felt like at home there.

Reviews.Title: “ottoman essences-Esans Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: acaciaDubai
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Esans hotel on winter time.It was raining and windy.but when I arrived the hotel,I felt very very hot.I mean staff are very friendly(always smiling)make me so positif. I love Istanbul.The hotel is very closed all places.I went every where by walk.on the terace of hotel see the Topkapi place wall.It is like a you are in ottoman times or I dreamed it.very nice view from the terace. I recomend this hotel to everyone.Also I have to say that I like the Cariye essence.(Ä°t is very fresh.without alchol.).for myboyfriend I bought Sultan essence. I will come back to Istanbul old city Istanbul-Esans Hotel to feel the ottoman times.I love old times.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and room”
Reviews.Author: ReinhardGkan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right in the centre of istambul sultanahmet mosque blue area old city. We went everywhere by walking. Old city cultural sights are very close to the hotel. The room was very nice and colorfull decorated. The staff was extraordinary helpful. They are good in English to discuss the details of the important events and monuments in Istanbul. The rate was included with nice breakfast. like a mediterian type including different kinds of cheese and olives as well as fruit jams. We liked the Hotel very much and I am planning to stay there again for my business travel in March.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent House in Old Town Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: 77eliza
Reviews.Content: Esans Hotel, they describe themselves as Traditional Modern Receiving House. They are the most friendly staff I have ever seen in Hotels that I have been. It is a family managed Hotel with taking care of their customers very much. Providing good Hints for your travel including touristic places as well as non popular but ethnical concerts, events... We have been a nice Turkish etnical concert and dervish ceromony by this chance. Really amusing performences. The rooms have different colors in the Hotel. We need to change room during our stay due to unavaibility, however it was nice since we tasted totally different colors, authentic atmosphere. The hotel is clean and breakfast was nice. I left my belt in the room, after 2 days they sent me an email. Great service, I would recommend it for sure.

Reviews.Title: “The Best In Istanbul Old City”
Reviews.Author: f_j0hns0n
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in Istanbul Old City. We found Esans Hotel in reviews here and was wondering about it till the last moment. It definitely made us satistied. A great location. It is at the foot of Topkapi Palace and Hagia Sophia. The staff really do their utmost to make you feel at Home. Even my sickness a bit restricted us, the staff kept their eye on us and supplied us some medicines and herbal tea for my throat. They treat like we are one of their relatives. It is very important to understand real Culture instead of touristic attractions. The room was very spacious, nice and clean. We suggest it definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it”
Reviews.Author: Jiezhu
Reviews.Content: The location, the staff, the room itself was all very awesome. i didnt know much about istanbul but they helped me have the best stay ever!!!! If i ever go back to istanbul, I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A real gem in the middle of historical city highlights”
Reviews.Author: Simmiloula
Reviews.Content: We came to spend Christmas and my birthday in Istanbul, a time which was absolutely fantastic. This beautiful hotel added so much to making our visit so special. The rooms are clean, spacious, beautifully decorated and unique, and the staff including the owner are knowledgable, kind and very very helpful. This hotel is certainly a gem in the middle of city's historical highlights and is one of a kind that deserves to be recommeded to any visitor who enjoy the comforts of extraordinary boutique hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to rest”
Reviews.Author: Anton1977
Reviews.Content: I like spending time on the old city istanbul during my business trips. Esans Hotel is like a secret place in Istanbul old city and a next door neighbour to the Topkapi Palace. The staff has very friendly and hospital in treatment. Well, the hotel has well welcoming atmosphere, which really surrounds you in a glance as you enter the very well restored old building. The location made it extremely easy to walk to all of the old city important sights like the St. Sophia church and Sultanahmet. Staff also advise me some nice advanced sights to see in the old city, like old book seller bazaar saaflar and chora museum. That was something I coluld never have checked, without local advise. The rooms are very nice decorated with colourful textiles giving a nice and comfortable sleep. The breakfast was nice also. Not a 5 -3 star hotel breakfast ok, but it was nice to have some local kinds of mezes and hot plates and fresh orange juice. It was also so kind of the staff to let me check in early in the morning without asking any extracost. I could say I'm really highly satisfied with an even short 4 days stay and I'm definitely planning to come with my friends, enjoy Istanbul on a much longer opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: jasxie90
Reviews.Content: I didnt know much about Istanbul but the staff there helped plan all the places that are worth seeing and I had a lot of fun! the rooms are cozy and very clean! Everything was within walkable distance and the people the worked there made my trip all the better! Definitely worth the price and I would for sure recommend it to all my friends!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best place I stayed at during my travels”
Reviews.Author: jasminexie
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is just perfect. Even though its really close to all the major attractions, its still very peaceful at night. The staff there are extremely helpful in planning my staying in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “sweet spot near Topkapi”
Reviews.Author: HRPETS
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Esan's Hotel in Sultanhamet in early October. The staff was exceptional, and very helpful. The breakfasts were nice on the roof. There are many places to chose from in Sultanhamet, but Esan's, is tucked away and very close to Topkapi Palace. I would highly recommend trying to get a room on the upper floor, to get an incredible view of the Bosporus. I would definitely try and stay there again when I go back to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: reggie_ten
Reviews.Content: I travel to Turkey often, especially Izmir and Istanbul, due to business, and usually stay in standard business hotels. This time, the hotel was booked by a local colleague and I must say it is an excellent boutique hotel with superb turkish hospitality. The location is very close to all the amenities, including monuments and museums and there are many restaurants and pubs close by, although the hotel is still very silent. The staff was very helpfull and friendly with all of our demands. The breakfast buffe was pretty good and varied. The room was nice and in style with their "Esans" themes. I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a hidden gem in Istanbul. Hopefully I can go with my wife next time and take a few days off to fully enjoy the place.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for giving us a great memories”
Reviews.Author: Wael-Rasha
Reviews.Content: i stayed with my wife for 6 nights and we loved it , Very nice hotel and charming 1- Great breakfast , daily new collection 2- Location close to all main attractions 3- Staff very helpful , I am really missed all of them 4- Nice view for the sea specially from the trace Thanks for giving us a great memories Kind Regards Wael Farag

Reviews.Title: “Great place in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Vera_zebra
Reviews.Content: I really loved it. 1. Great people - all staff is very friendly 2. Great room - very clean, comfortable and authentic 3. Great location - 5 minutes to all main attractions 4. Great place 4 a romantic getaway - queit and charming.

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVED THIS HOTEL - CLOSE TO EVERYTHING AND FRIENDLY STAFF”
Reviews.Author: DAVE_and_ADRIENNE
Reviews.Content: Very cozy hotel with friendly staff. My wife and I stayed for 2 nights and we loved it. The special attention from the staff was welcomed. Very clean room with a view of the Bosphorus. The included breakfast was great.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly, cosy and welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: michelleforster
Reviews.Content: This cosy little hotel is tucked away in a quiet street within very short walking distance of major attractions in Sultanahmed. The staff go out of their way to make you feel welcome and help with anything you need. Its heritage as a perfumery makes it an interesting place in itself. The lovely staff even gave me a little present when I left. I will stay here again when I return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly newly refurbished hotel, good place to stay !”
Reviews.Author: marie05Bournemouth
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was lovely. As they refurbished it recently, the hotel is clean and the staff is very friendly with a good english ! They guide us to nice local turkish restaurants and to lovely places to visit. As the hotel is closed to the seaside, you can go by walk. We enjoyed our stay in Istanbul and this hotel is definitely a good place to sleep !!

Reviews.Title: “tolles, freundliches hotel”
Reviews.Author: muenchen1978
Reviews.Content: we had booked in another hotel in sultanahmet istanbul. however they were full once we get there, and we found Esans Hotel by chance. it is much more beautiful hotel.it is a run family hotel. . I was very suprised with their location. like opposite of topkapi museum. important cultural signs are very near walking. rooms are decodated very elegantly. Very helpful friendly staff. . my husband needed a pc to go into internet. hotel management let us use their computer. they also guide us very local nice restaurants and hammam turkish. so we are very happy since hotel management suggests local and friendly places to visit. most important we had silent stay. all perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: black_condor
Reviews.Content: The hotel has very good reviews both on here and on booking.com. That's why my friend and I decided to book a room there. Alas, we were very disappointed. While located conveniently in the center of old Istanbul, the quality of the hotel itself leaves much more to be desired. There was nothing majorly disturbing about it but there were so many little things that just made our stay quite an exhausting one. The staff don't speak good enough English to hold any sort of intelligent discussion. For example, when booking we exchanged emails and received a confirmation that we would get a room on the 3rd floor. When we arrived, we got a 2nd-floor room and all we got in response to showing a print-out of the email correspondence was "sorry, it's booked". Another issue with this hotel is that it has wooden floors that don't muffle any sound. In fact, they make every step sound like thunderstorm. So, if you have inconsiderate neighbors upstairs, this turns into a huge problem, which was our case. I have no idea what they were doing but it was unbearable. I went to talk to them and they started screaming at me. We mentioned the problem of noisy neighbors to the person at the reception but the hotel was unwilling to do anything about it. They pretended not to understand the issue and just shrugged it off. Again, this brings me to the matter of poor English language skills. Perhaps it's just a strategy to deal with conflict, I don't know. The outcome was that our problem wasn't solved. The rooms themselves were nice. The bed was comfy; the linens clean and fresh. However, when we moved in, there was a lot of hair in the sink drain. After the first night the cleaning lady took two towels and never replaced them so we had to call the reception and ask them to bring them. We also discovered that the cleaning lady threw out all our special airport plastic bags for liquids that were stacked nicely next to our colognes. At the same time, the trash cans weren't emptied. The breakfast was very poor. I travel very often and usually know what to expect for the money I am paying. There was some cheese, some bread, some cold cuts, a few bowls of canned olives and omelette. There was no coffee, only an instant coffee-like drink. The breakfast table just looked depressing. We didn't care to have breakfast at the hotel the next two mornings, especially since you can have a nice morning meal for, like, 5 euros in any of the surrounding cafes. Finally, on the day we were checking out we saw the tiny lobby of the hotel packed with locals waiting for something. Turned out the hotel was a gathering point for owner's friends or relatives to go to an engagement ceremony. Now, is that a way to run a hotel?! If it were a B&B or a hostel - go ahead. But it's a HOTEL, for crying out loud! Overall, the hotel has potential. If you're lucky you will have a nice time. However, in case you don't get lucky, you'll regret it. I am just not sure it's worth the risk.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: albdanua
Reviews.Content: Esans hotel is a very nice and beautiful hotel. rooms are very oriental decorated, staff is very kind and helpful. They can understand and speak english well. our room was clean and very nice. and it was cleaned every day. Esans hotel is a new and relaxed hotel. That was my second trip in istanbul, and my girlfriends first. we choose this hotel because of its location and beautiful rooms. And the location in actually very near all the historical places of sultanahmed. we colund visit every place by walk. Normally the photos on web page are always a little "corrected" and your room will be not the same as the photos shown on site. But i think some of the photos on site was the photos of our room. And we stayed on a regular double room. My girlfriend really enjoyed the hotel and trip. She loved the historical fragrances selling at the hotel too. everything was excellent. The weather was rainy at our trip so we didnt enjoyed the roof at esans hotel. I am sure that haveing breakfast on the roof will be very nice. I hope we will visit the hotel again in summer. I fully recommend this hotel to all people who is going to visit istanbul and sultanahmed.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: noorderkim
Reviews.Content: After all the years that we have been coming to Istanbul, we were very pleasantly surprised to find a quiet (!)corner of Sultanahmet, not twohundred metres from the Topkapi entrance, in a charming old building with great, clean rooms, a relaxed atmosphere, a very hospitable young couple running the place...we will be back! Erik & Mik
